subject: Re: Letter #26?
msgSnippet: The logic behind the rule, from my understanding, is that there are two distinctive types of words that end in the -Y sound: Stressed & unstressed. The -Y
messageBody:
The logic behind the rule, from my understanding, is that there are
two distinctive types of words that end in the -Y sound: Stressed &
unstressed. The -Y sound in "city" & "legatee" are similar but
different, British & American pronunciations aside.

While the rule does break the "one letter, one sound" rule that the
alphabet has, it is a Senior Quikscript rule & doesn't need to be
followed in Junior Quikscript.
